Situation1: Communicate openly to resolve conflicts or misunderstandings.
Expectation2: Attend weekly church services to worship and participate in community activities
Situation2: They are expected to attend every service and take part in church community activities consistently
Story: This Sunday morning, I sat at the kitchen table, my phone buzzing with messages from my church group, reminding me about the service and the community lunch afterward. I knew how important it was to be present, not just for worship but to show my commitment to the community. At the same time, my younger sister sat across from me, her eyes red from crying after our argument last night. She barely touched her breakfast, and I could feel the tension between us. I remembered our parents always said that as sisters, we should talk things through and never let misunderstandings fester. I wanted to reach out, to listen and rebuild the trust between us, but the clock was ticking closer to the time I needed to leave for church. My heart pulled in two directions—toward my faith and my community, and toward my sister, who needed me right now. I felt the weight of both expectations pressing down, unsure which role I should honor in this moment.
